intro: Echinops ecbatanus, commonly known as the Ecbatana thistle, is a flowering plant native to central Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and spiny foliage. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its spherical, spiky seed heads are a distinctive feature, often appearing after the summer months. Echinops ecbatanus is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in traditional medicine.
